Module contents

class PyAutoExcel.Engines.BaseReader(file: bytes | str | IOBase)

Bases: ABC

Base class for Excel readers.

This class is abstract and should not be instantiated directly.

Parameters:

file – The file to read.

Subclasses must implement the following methods:

  • _setup(): Set up the reader.

  • _parse(): Read the sheets from the file.

Subclasses must also set the following class variables:

  • __engine__: The name of the engine used by the reader.

Subclasses may also set the following class variable:

  • __deprecated__: A DeprecatedInfo object containing information about the reader’s deprecation.

property nsheets: int

Return the number of sheets.

sheet_by_index(index: int)

Return the sheet at the given index.

sheet_by_name(name: str)

Return the sheet with the given name.

property sheet_names: list[str]

Return the list of sheet names.

property sheets: list[Sheet]

Return the list of sheets.

class PyAutoExcel.Engines.BaseWriter

Bases: ABC

Base class for Excel writers.

Subclasses must implement the following methods:

  • _setup(): Set up the writer.

  • _write(): Writing data.

  • _output(): Export the file.

Subclasses must also set the following class variables:

  • __engine__: The name of the engine used by the reader.

Subclasses may also set the following class variable:

  • __deprecated__: A DeprecatedInfo object containing information about the reader’s deprecation.

save(saver: str | IOBase | None) → bytes | None

Saves the Excel file to the specified location or stream.

Parameters:

saver (Union[None, str, io.BytesIO]) – The file path or stream to save to. If None, the file will be saved to memory.

Returns:

If param ‘saver’ is None, return the content as bytes. Otherwise, return None.

property sheets: list[Sheet]

Gets the list of sheets.

Returns:

The list of sheets.
